poem:
Morning Headlines

Wage growth slows,
economic alchemy fizzles,
chip stocks fall like autumn leaves. 

In the ballet of markets,
tensions pirouette between US, China, Taiwan.
Vacancies drift like vacant eyes,
an August rate cut dangles—
today's data, tomorrow's hope.

In the ticker tape shuffle,
tiny dramas unfold,
currencies breathe,
and we live in the spaces between.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "UK wage growth slows; global chip stocks fall amid growing tensions between US, China and Taiwan – business live 9.06am BST Meanwhile, Sanjay Raja, chief UK economist at Deutsche Bank, said the cooling labour market keeps an August rate cut in play. After a sticky services CPI [consumer prices index] print, today’s data paints a more encouraging picture of the labour market. Wage growth is receding and vacancies continue to drop. The economic activity rate". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
